intro: Sorolepidium ovale, commonly known as the oval spike-rush, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and compact, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils in woodland or heathland environments. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine, translucent hairs. Sorolepidium ovale is often found in shaded, wet areas and is an important component of the flora in its native habitat.
